New Records: Indiana Sets NBA Record That Will Never Be Replicated
Post-Match Reflections: Indiana head coach Rick Carlisle said: 'He was great. He played efficient. He played smart. He seemed to always be in the right place at the right time.'

Rick Carlisle elaborated: 'He's very adaptable. When you're in the league nine, 10 years, and you've been with some different teams and you've had to learn new system and new players, you become a very resilient player and a very adaptable player and that showed tonight.'

Pascal Siakam said: 'He knows that there's a real chance out there. You get some minutes. You get to play with a group that just wants to play good basketball. He has a chance to come in, play hard, bring energy, set screens. Then you're going to get open shots too.'
Tyrese Haliburton said: 'Give me 12 Thomas Bryants in the fact of just his energy and willingness to do the right things.'
Thomas Bryant said: 'They've embraced me so much just from when I first stepped in of trying to get me into their offense and their defense and communicating with me throughout the whole time.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Indiana Pacers won the game 129-113 against the Chicago Bulls.
Thomas Bryant recorded 22 points, eight rebounds, two steals, and one assist in the game.
Bryant's teammates praised him for his energy and adaptability.
